intro: Apinagia intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate apinagia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it blooms during the summer months. Apinagia intermedia is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and potential medicinal properties.
